author: R Sivaraman
text:
Senior Congress leader and former Union Minister of State V. Narayanasamy hinted that he would jump into the poll fray this time.

If he goes ahead with his plan, then it will be the first time that he will be facing polls. In his career he had been a Rajya Sabha member for three terms from 1985 to 2009.

Mr. Narayanasamy was elected to the 15th Lok Sabha in 2009, and became the Union Minister of State, Planning and Parliamentary Affairs. The Congress leader lost to AINRC candidate R. Radhakrishnan in the last parliamentary elections.
title: Narayanasamy hints at contesting elections
